BioText:
I'm Sean Otto, a software engineer based in the beautiful hills of Surrey, UK. 

I love developing games, front end websites and small command line programs.

I'm passionate about emergent-tech, beautiful interfaces and intuitive programming. 

To find out more about any of my projects, feel free to select any of the links at the top!

Projects.title: This Website!
Projects.desc:
This website was made with Gatsby and React, using a small JSON file to emulate a kind of back-end. 

 Feel free to modify and use for your own portfolio, you can find the repo below:

Projects.title: Recipe Search
Projects.desc:
A Full stack web application made in NodeJS, and hosted in vercel.

 Contains a REST api that allows you to query a Postgress database of recipes pulled from
 Food Network and simple front-end that let's you search through each recipe in the api. 

 Written with Nextjs in Typescript for both the api and frontend application.

Projects.title: vscode-language-renpy
Projects.desc:
Contributed to an extension that adds VSCode support to the Renpy Programming Language.

  Mostly a Typescript project, with a little bit of node for the running process

Projects.title: Minotaurus
Projects.desc:
A game where you wander around as a minotaur in a dungeon hunting mages (who also throw fireballs!). 

Made using Phaser and JavaScript. Code is available on github, and feel free to play it in the browser on itch!

Projects.title: Diece
Projects.desc:
A short section of a turn based combat module made in Renpy,
 where you play as a little guy and run do some combat against some not so little guys.

 Feel free to edit it and use it as you wish

Projects.title: TicTacToeMultiplayer
Projects.desc:
A tic tac toe client/server pair made with SDL2 and Java. Uses TCP to transfer a single string over a network port. 

Server was made in Java using the FXGL game engine.

Projects.title: Trade-Checker
Projects.desc:
Simple Command Line program I made for a coding challenge.

 It monitors a folder for a specific file to be added, then moves that file to an archive and adds it to a database. 

 Uses C# for the main application and SQLite for the database.

Projects.title: Python Graph Implementation
Projects.desc:
A Python Project I started when I wanted to learn more about data structures and algorithms.

 Contains a simple implementation of Dijkstra's Algorithm, along with a reusable Graph data structure (which uses a linked list to respresent Nodes) 

 Made Completely in Python 3.12, to take advantage of the extra type hinting.

Experiences.title: Junior Software Engineer · Nexudus
Experiences.desc: Styled and iterated upon company websites for multi-national co-working spaces, including firms such as Meta, citizenM, Roundhouse Works and Platform. Provided continued support and assistance to clients throughout the process, increasing team overall CSAT score throughout the entire process

Experiences.title: Lead Code Teacher · Code Camp
Experiences.desc:
Taught Kids how to use CodeCamp World, a javascript-based game design framework. 
Mostly consisted of short, after school lessons. Code Camp also does holiday camps with more intensive training.
